events.name: Public Talk: Window 8’s evolving developments
events.description:
SYNOPSIS: 
Information Technology has been rapidly evolving over the years with new developments in the creation of hardware and software solutions for various applications. In today’s IT scenario, new devices and technologies emerge every now and then. While computers in the form of laptops and smart devices have become an essential part of our daily lives, be it for work, entertainment or creativity. With new developments in technologies, developers have a greater challenge to provide support for multiple product platforms to meet the needs of the end users and the usage scenarios of a program. In this context, a need for convenient and universal Application Programming Interface (API) becomes more desirable and relevant. 
This talk will cover the new features offered by Microsoft for a developer that contains innovative interface system of contracts and extensions usage of the platform programs and their possible interaction with files and Application Programming Interface (API). 
COME AND FIND OUT MORE! 
Date:     9th March 2015 (Monday) 
Time:     7.00 pm – 8.30 pm 
Venue:   Lecturer Theatre, City Campus 
   250, Middle Road 
   Singapore 188983 
Speaker: Mr. Mikhail Gospodarikov 
  
SPEAKER PROFILE: 
Having started his interest in IT & Web Development since 11 years old, Mikhail Gospodarikov is a published speaker with years of experience in programming. He started his IT career with web development and he eventually learnt IT administration and networking. He won a grand-prix and a golden insignia in 2013 for his acclaimed application development for Windows 8 operating software. 
Register with us at 6690 9599 / 6671 2799 or events@tmc.edu.sg by 27th February 2015 to secure your seat. Hurry! Seats are limited. 
  
Don't miss out on this opportunity and bring your friends along. Click http://www.tmc.edu.sg/index.php/component/k2/item/286 for details.
events.location: TMC Academy, Lecture Theatre, , 250 Middle Rd, Singapore 188983

events.name: 'No boilerplate code' night
events.description: This month we have 2 senior speakers from Palo-IT . They will show some great ways to reduce your boilerplate code. 6:45 - 7:15 :: Food and networking 7:15 - 8:45 :: Talks and Q&A 8:45 - 9:00 :: Mingling -------------- First Talk: Removing boilerplate code with Lombok Speaker: Eric Lefevre . Senior Software Developer, Palo-IT. 15 years of experience Java programmer. His interview is available here . Abstract: Sick of writing setters and getters? toString()/equals()/hashCode() methods? Jealous of those new, less-verbose programming languages? Discover Lombok, a tool that will make your Java code easier, lighter and better looking! Second talk - Spring Data JPA Speaker: Cédric Arnoult . technical leader, Palo-IT. 15 years of experience Java programmer. Also used to be a Java instructor, loves to teach and share knowledge. His interview is available here . Abstract: Spring Data JPA, the best way to get "wowwwwww" again when doing database access. Easy, reliable and efficient, you'll love it. I'll talk about our experience with using it in our customer's project. =====================
events.location: PayPal office in Millenia Tower, 1 Temasek Avenue Millenia Tower #14-01, Singapore

events.name: An evening on Pre and Post Video Productions
events.description: Programme Details Why is pre-production the most important stage of any video project? by Robert Cristobal Find out why not spending time to hone ideas before filming can be counter productive. Color Video Grading by Lynus Hee Movies often use colours to emote a story. To give your videos the cinematic look you don't need fancy machines or softwares to do it. Adobe Certified Instructor Lynus Hee will explain the theory behind colour grading and demonstrate a method that can be used in Adobe Photoshop, Premiere Pro and After Effects. Our Speakers Robert Cristobal Robert Cristobal, Creative Storyteller from Frame 316 will share how you can maximize your production from the preparation steps and get practical techniques to make the life of the people in your production team easier. Lynus Hee Apart from a great sense of humour, I have 18 years of experience as a motion graphics designer and photographer. I am also an Adobe Certified Instructor (Video Specialist) and provide training for Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Premiere Pro and Adobe After Effects.
events.location: Toa Payoh Library, 6 Toa Payoh Central, Singapore

events.name: Azure Community March Meetup
events.description: Hi All, We would like to invite you to Azure Community Singapore March Meetup. Please join this exciting community and learn more on Azure for your cloud development as well as you web/network infrastructure. There will be several topics to be shared but if you want to contribute as well, please do let me know are just come forward on the event day. Please bring your IT Pro or developers friends to join. See you all and let's have fun in the cloud. Topics Agenda: • Its' all about Virtual Network in Azure for beginner. - Riza • Create Proxy or VPN in Azure and maybe you can watch Netflix at the same time. - Terence Lim • Reality of the Clouds . Good or bad times. Prepare an umbrella before raining and always have backup clothing to deal with rain, sort of. - Goh Chun Lin • Etc. ( anyone care to contribute, please let me know ) Notes : I'm also looking for Ruby , Joyent Node.js , io.js , Python , Java and PHP expert who uses Azure PaaS or IaaS. Please help to contribute for this community. Many thanks and we appreciate it. Wi-Fi : Available (Free) Food : Available (Thanks to Microsoft Singapore) Door Prize : We need sponsors for this :) but, there will be a surprise.
events.location: 22CF12, Level 22, Microsoft Singapore, Singapore 018989, One Marina Boulevard

events.name: Shaping the Future: Inside the Creative Mind
events.description: Wednesday 11th March 2015 2:30pm to 5:30pm ArtScience Museum, Level 4 FREE Shaping the Future: Inside the Creative Mind What is creativity and what role does it play in today’s increasingly homogenized world? Six leading practitioners of their respective crafts will gather to share their unique perspectives in an afternoon of illuminating insights and discussion. This is an event organized by the British Council and ArtScience Museum, and curated by Pomeroy Studio. The session will be hosted by Eco-architect, Professor Jason Pomeroy and speakers include: • Andrew Grant, Grant Associates • Jonathan Schütz, Award Winning TV director • Stephen Pimbley, Founder of SPARK Architects • Professor Anthony Bowne, Principal of Trinity Laban Conservatoire of Music & Dance • Tim Ross-Watson, Celebrity Chef Please go to http://peatix.com/event/75938 to register for this event.
events.location: ArtScience Museum

events.name: Nico Nico Gakkai Beta in Science Centre Singapore
events.description: All presentation in English NicoNicoGakkai Beta is a new style of academy that emphasizes user-generated research. It is an online and offline research academy that recognizes research on a diversity of merits, from cultural and artistic values to academic and industrial strengths. (http://blog.stepup.io/post/71963779785/nico-nico-gakkai-the-craziest-japanese-science) Rapid Fire Research 100 “Rapid Fire Research 100” was one of the two formats unique to this conference. In just 15 minutes, five world class researchers made 20 pitches each about their presentation. As a result, each speaker had to go though their 20~30 years worth of research in a very short time. To the audience, it was a comprehensive guide to each field as well as a motivating talk about how (initially) humble and error-prone research turns into world changing results. --In Japanese------------------------- ニコニコ学会βの人気企画、「研究100連発」を、 塚田 浩二 野嶋 琢也 寺田 努 稲見 昌彦 Jun Rekimoto 各先生方、および Maker Faire Singaporeの協力を得て、シンガポールサイエンスセンター・オーディトリウムにて、開館を特別に延長して行います！ 会場のサイエンスセンターはJulong East駅、AH2015が行われるマリーナ・ベイ・サンズから電車で40分ほどのところです。17:30-のAH2015終了後に会場に来ても間に合います！ もちろん入場無料です。ぜひご参加ください。 (プレゼンは英語ですが、動画も多いので誰が見てもわかると思います) Thanks Suranga Nanayakkara, Kiruthika Curic , Chan Sue Li and Maker Faire Singapore!
events.location: Science Centre Singapore

events.name: 4th Tableau User Group Singapore Meetup
events.description: Hi Everyone, We are excited to organize the 4th Tableau User Group Singapore (TUGS) meeting. Tableau has offered to use the meeting room at their office at Wheelock Place. There is limited room, so sign up quickly. If you have signed up, and can't make it, please revise your RSVP, so that people on the waiting list will be able to join. The agenda will be as follows. 16:00 Refreshments and Networking 16:25 Welcome and introduction (5 min) 16:30 1st Topic (20min) 16:50 Tableau Announcements / Topics (10min) 17:00 2nd Topic (20min) - Re-viz-it 17:20 3rd Topic (20min) 17:40 Interesting Links, Blogs and Articles (5 min) 17:45 Q&A and Collective Problem Solving (15 min) 18:00 Closing Bring your laptop with Tableau installed, if you have problems, you could show and ask the group, or one-on-one. If you are interested to show your awesome Tableau Visualization, or want to share a really cool trick you found, let us know we can either slot you in for a 10-15 min demo, or we could do it during the Q&A and Collective Problem Solving. One last request : Since this is the first event organized by us, we would like to get to know you a little better. Help us by filling in a quick survey to tell about yourself, and what you would like to see from the Tableau User Group. Singapore Tableau User Group Survey Thanks Richard, Zane and Jimmy TUGS Organizers
events.location: Wheelock Place, 501 Orchard Road, Singapore

events.name: DIY PCB Etching With Everyday Household Materials
events.description: It is possible to create and make your own PCB without the use of dangerous chemicals. Simply by using Vineger, Hydrogen Peroxide and Salt you are able to make fairly complex PCB boards. The process is simple and fast and gives you the flexibility to make 1 single board or multiple different prototype boards for testing. This workshop will introduce participants to the process of making PCB boards using a laser printer, transfer media paper and a heat press machine. Participants will get to make and assemble a working PCB board containing a 7805 regulator circuit that will take in 7-12V and output 5V. All materials are provided. This is a paid workshop. if you are interested, please sign up here: http://learn.12geeks.com/event/4 This event is brought to you by 12Geeks[1] and Touch & Print[2] in collaboration with FOSSASIA. Check out past event photos . For enquiries email contact@12geeks.com or call (+65) 9179 8353. NB. Do note that building security will be tight that day due to the opening of the Singapore design week. [1] http://12geeks.com/shop [2] http://www.themagictouch.com.sg/main/index.php
events.location: IDA Labs Level 2 @ National Design Centre, 111 Middle Road, #02-04, Singapore

events.name: The Art of Copy
events.description: ======================== Registration Details (at Xerox Building) ========================= Registration starts from 5.45pm, please proceed immediately to level 4, Fuji Xerox Tower at Anson Road. This session will start at 6.00pm. ========================= Speakers Bio ========================= Mark Plunkett Design Director of Dexel and Generic Print Shirley Tan Training Director of ACE Training ========================= Meeting Topics ========================= Session 1 Copying objects is one of those tasks InDesign users do all the time. However, I regularly come across users who aren't aware that there are many ways to copy beyond the standard copy and paste command. Join me in this session and be amazed at the many more powerful ways that InDesign can help you duplicate stuff. Session 2 Ever wondered about editorial layouts and how we can fit copy into allocated text boxes or what are copy editing terms such as Rags, Widows and Orphans. Good typography requires a good sense of understanding about creating a copy layout with simple and easy to read columns. Some may be easily solved with InDesign, while others requires manual editing. Come and join us in this meeting to learn more about the art of copy. ========================= Agenda ========================= 6.00pm - 6.30pm Session 1 with Shirley Tan 6.30pm - 6.40pm Short break & Refreshments 6.40pm - 7.10pm Session 2 with Mark Plunkett 7.10pm - 7.30pm FAQ session ========================= Refreshments ========================= Hot beverages, water and snacks will be provided during the meeting with compliments from Fuji Xerox Singapore. ========================= Facebook ========================= http://www.facebook.com/groups/idugsg/ ========================= Twitter ========================= @InDesignSG ========================= Sponsors ========================= This meeting has been made possible with the generous support of Adobe and Fuji Xerox Singapore.
events.location: Fuji Xerox Singapore Level 4

events.name: Singapore Windows IT Pro User Group March Meet Up
events.description: Event Details Date : 12th March 2015 (Thursday) Time : 1845hr – 2030hr Venue : Microsoft Singapore Level 21 Auditorium |1 Marina Boulevard, #21-01 Singapore[masked] Agenda : 1845hr – Registration 1930hr – Introduction to Cybercrime Center & Digital Crime Unit 2030hr – Q&A Session 2100hr – Home Sweet Home Abstract: • Introduction to Microsoft Digital Crimes Unit (DCU) & its malware disruption operations • Microsoft Cybercrime Center & leveraging Big-Data to fight malware • Cyber-Threat Intelligence Program (CTIP) & public-private partnerships • PhotoDNA & protecting sexual abuse of Children online • Role of the Cybercrime Satellite Center in Singapore & the Asia-Pacific Region • Building a Trusted Cloud with Cyber-Threat Intelligence Speaker Bio: Jonathan Selvasegaram Corporate Attorney - Microsoft Corporation Jonathan Selvasegaram is a Corporate Attorney for Microsoft Corporation for the Southeast Asia region and works specifically in Malaysia, Singapore, Indonesia and Brunei. Jonathan is part of the newly established Digital Crimes Unit (DCU) and based in Microsoft Legal and Corporate Affairs’ regional headquarters in Singapore since 2001. He primarily focuses on intellectual property protection, cybercrime, cyber-forensics and Government affairs/policy across these 4 countries and works closely with related industry partners, Government and law enforcement agencies. He has conducted trainings on intellectual property laws, protection and enforcement experience and shared best practices across the region with Judges, Magistrates, Police and lawyers. Jonathan has 19 years of IP protection experience. Prior to joining Microsoft, he spent 2 years as legal counsel for the Recording Industry Association of Malaysia (RIM). During his time at RIM, Jonathan headed up the legal department and was responsible for civil and criminal litigation cases. Prior to his career in the music industry, he spent 7 years in the Intellectual Property Department of law firm, Raja, Darryl & Loh in Kuala Lumpur where he worked as a paralegal and then as an Advocate and Solicitor and was responsible for handling trademark registrations and the enforcement of intellectual property rights.
events.location: Microsoft Singpaore, One Marina Boulevard, Level 21 Auditorum, Singapore 018989

events.name: FOSSASIA Pre-Meetup at Bugis - Steamboat and Get together at Jaz Blu Cafe
events.description: Let’s join up for a pre-meetup with FOSSASIA speakers and attendees already in town. We start off with a traditional Singapore hotpot at Beach Road and then meet up at Jaz Blue Cafe in Bugis. Dinner : Enjoy a traditional Singapore Hotpot/Steamboat at Bugis Beach Road. There is an option for a flatrate and lots of yummy seafood. Bar Meetup : Let’s enjoy some drinks just a few steps away after dinner at Jaz Blu Cafe Date: Thursday, March 12, 2015 Time: 7:00PM Location: Beach Road Steamboat and Jaz Blu Cafe Directions: Public Transport: Go to Bugis MRT Station and walk to Beach Road. Look out for our group of international geeks and designers in the Beach Road Seafood Hotpot restaurant at the corner. About Blu Jaz Cafe • http://www.blujazcafe.net • Serves beer, wine, and additional finger food • If a lot of people sign up, we will reserve the 2nd floor Links FOSSASIA: http://fossasia.org Twitter: https://twitter.com/fossasia

events.name: FOSSASIA Social Event at Labrador Seaside View BBQ
events.description: Let’s get together with speakers and attendees of FOSSASIA 2015 at Labrador Seaside View BBQ! We will have four superb cuisine chefs who are known for their delicious BBQ food creations. Different meat, vegetarian and vegan options are available. Typical Singaporean beverages are served during the party. Of course there will be music and like in previous years we hope to see some international dance performances of our participants from around the world! The beautiful Labrador park is our perfect location to enjoy the friendly company of FOSSASIA participants at the seaside. Get a ticket here ! Date: Friday, March 13 Time: 6.45PM Location: Labrador Park Seaside View BBQ Directions: Public Transport: Labrador Park Station - Circle Line Station | Drive: 12~15 min drive, or 5 stops/10 min MRT (+ 10 min walk) Please get a ticket for the social event at: http://fossasia.eventbrite.com About Labrador Park The park is a hidden gem and an unusual historical relic in otherwise ultra-modern Singapore located right at the seaside. First developed in the mid-19th century as Fort Pasir Panjang, the fortifications in today’s Labrador Park were later renamed the Labrador Battery in the 1930s as the British Army prepared for a possible Japanese invasion. More Info on TA and Wikipedia . Links FOSSASIA: http://fossasia.org Twitter: https://twitter.com/fossasia Tickets: http://fossasia.eventbrite.com Labrador Park Wikipedia: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Labrador_Nature_Reserve
events.location: Labrador Park MRT (CC27) Station Control, Labrador Park, Singapore

events.name: Meetup and Get Certified by the Linux Foundation at FOSSASIA
events.description: Join us for a Linux Foundation meetup and get certified as the Linux Engineer (LFCE) or the Linux System Administrator (LFCS) at FOSSASIA in Singapore for a special one-time discount of 100 USD off usual rates in cooperation with OlinData . We'll have a dedicated room on Saturday March 14, 2015 at Blk71 where you can sit down in all quietness and take the examination so you can walk away with one of the highest quality Linux Certification in the industry. Click here to sign up . A Linux Foundation Certified System Administrator (LFCS) has the skills to do basic to intermediate system administration from the command-line for systems running Linux. Linux Foundation Certified System Administrators are knowledgeable in the operational support of Linux systems and services. They are responsible for first line troubleshooting and analysis, and decide when to escalate issues to engineering teams. More information here: training.linuxfoundation.org/certification/lfcs Online Self-Paced Course : If you want to make sure you are prepared for the LFCS exam we have a great deal for you: By taking a special edition of the online self-paced course for the LFCS certification, you'll be well prepared for the LFCS certification and at the same time supporting FOSSASIA. Please go here to proceed. A Linux Foundation Certified Engineer (LFCE) possesses a wider range and greater depth of skills than the Linux Foundation Certified System Administrator (LFCS). Linux Foundation Certified Engineers are responsible for the design and implementation of system architecture. They provide an escalation path and serve as Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) for the next generation of system administration professionals. More information here: http://training.linuxfoundation.org/certification/lfcs Links FOSSASIA: http://fossasia.org Twitter: https://twitter.com/fossasia Certification: http://fossasia.org/linux
events.location: NUS Plug-In@Blk71, Ayer Rajah Crescent, #05-16, Singapore

events.name: PowerShell for Beginners
events.description: Just getting started with PowerShell? No problem! This is a half day event for complete beginners. Using recorded content from the Microsoft Virtual Academy and demonstrations from a PowerShell MVP and the User Group Leads, you'll finish the day much more confident with PowerShell than you were before. We have been hearing from the Community that there are not enough sessions for Beginners, also, some people are not confident about using PowerShell because they haven't had a good enough grounding in the fundamentals. We would like to address that. Using some amazing content on the Microsoft Virtual Academy by PowerShells creator Jeffrey Snover and PowerShell MVP Jason Helmick,we will cover some basics of PowerShell; using the shell, understanding Objects, mastering the Help system and understanding the Pipeline. These are core skills that once mastered will help you advance faster along your PowerShell journey. This session will be delivered using Videos from the MVA, group discussions, demos by the group leads and hands on. It is important to bring your own laptop, as the intended outcome of this is to build confidence through your own hands-on experience. You can find the MVA content that we will follow at http://www.microsoftvirtualacademy.com/training-courses/getting-started-with-powershell-3-0-jump-start . It is recommended that you watch Video 01 before the day as preparation. We will cover videos 2 to 5 together on the day and any more if time allows. Following this session you can finish the MVA course on your own time or join us for another session in March to finish, if you prefer the group interaction. Please remember this is for Complete Beginners and all content will be at that level, though Intermediate folks may learn some tips and tricks along the way also. See you there!
events.location: Microsoft Singapore, One Marina Boulevard, Level 22, Meeting Room

events.name: Paper Crafting
events.description: Participants will learn about paper craft. Using techniques such as quilling and beadmaking, participants with learn how to fashion jewellery out of paper and other everyday materials
events.location: Toa Payoh Hdb Hub

events.name: Build your own distro with Lubuntu's Julien Lavergne
events.description: How useful would it be to give your customers a ready configured OS, that suits their needs right away? Or just how cool would it be to create your own OS for fun? Julien Lavergne Lubuntu maintainer will show us how to create your own distro based on Lubuntu. Meet us at FOSSASIA in the NUS Plug-In@Blk71 Lounge on Sunday at 10.30 (March 15). In the workshop you will learn several ways to to create a distro with different tools. We will show you how to start work from different base systems or distributions. You will learn about what choices are available for different use cases and how you can adapt your distribution for a specific country or for a specific showcase with your own applications. About Julien Lavergne Julien is a contributor in Ubuntu and Debian for 10 years. He is a Debian maintainer and an Ubuntu developer mainly working on the Lubuntu project as the main developer. https://gilir.wordpress.com | http://twitter.com/gilir Links Lubuntu: http://lubuntu.net FOSSASIA http://fossasia.org Twitter http://twitter.com/fossasia
events.location: NUS Plug-In@Blk71, Ayer Rajah Crescent, #05-16, Singapore

events.name: API LAB - Smart Nation API coLAB
events.description:
Padang & Co, together with DEXTRA, is bringing you a whole week of APIs at the Smart Nation API coLAB!   
Putting together partners in the "API Economy" and lots of public and private sector API owners, we'll be exploring how APIs can help unlock business value and play a key role in spurring new innovation. This is the perfect opportunity for you to absorb all things 'API'. 
  
The coLAB kicks off on Sunday, 15 March with the API LAB, followed by four API Nights during the week spanning themes such as Smart Living, Media & Entertainment, Transport, Travel & Places, and Fintech & Commerce . The whole week culminates in a spectacular Hack Day where you can experiement with over 100 APIs and wow us with their hacks during the show-and-tell.  
  
API LAB - Sunday, 15 March 
 The week begins with the an introduction to the 'API Economy' and how APIs can help unlock business value and spur innovation at the API LAB. Find out how you can foster innovation, forge partnerships and unlock new revenue streams.  
 Programme  
3.00pm - Welcome 
3.15pm - Smart Nation, the API Economy, and unlocking business value through APIs 
4.30pm - Technical Workshop 
6.00pm - Networking and drinks   
More Information 
To find out more about the coLAB visit: http://www.upsingapore.com/smart-nation-api-colab. Got any questions? Want to know how you can share your API at the coLAB? Drop us an email.
events.location: 237 South Bridge Rd, , 237 S Bridge Rd, Singapore 058786

Children also learn to communicate about their projects, participate in discussions and write about their work for a chance to get published! This is a day camp, 10am-4pm. Lunch will be provide

events.name: Smart Living API Night - Smart Nation API coLAB
events.description:
Padang & Co, together with DEXTRA, is bringing you a whole week of APIs at the Smart Nation API coLAB!   
Putting together partners in the "API Economy" and lots of public and private sector API owners, we'll be exploring how APIs can help unlock business value and play a key role in spurring new innovation. This is the perfect opportunity for you to absorb all things 'API'. 
  
The coLAB kicks off on Sunday, 15 March with the API LAB, followed by four API Nights during the week spanning themes such as Smart Living, Media & Entertainment, Transport, Travel & Places, and Fintech & Commerce . The whole week culminates in a spectacular Hack Day where you can experiement with over 100 APIs and wow us with their hacks during the show-and-tell.  
  
Smart Living API Night - Monday, 16 March 
In the first instalment of the themed API Nights, you can dive deep into industries like health and fitness, energy, and education and learn from API owners about how their APIs are making a difference. You will also get to network with partners and fellow like-minded participants to start thinking about what you want to work on at the Hack Day.  
Themed API Night Programme  
7.00pm - Welcome from Lead Partners 
7.20pm - Partners speak about their APIs, followed by Q&A 
9.00pm - Networking  
More Information 
To find out more about the coLAB visit: http://www.upsingapore.com/smart-nation-api-colab. Got any questions? Want to know how you can share your API at the coLAB? Drop us an email.
events.location: , , 237 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058786

events.name: Front End TL;DR March 2015
events.description: Let's visit migme, a startup that has been around forever and is currently reinventing itself as a social entertainment destination, complete with IPO and fresh funding from Foxconn last year. Come to learn about the host company but more importantly to learn front end tech technology. FEDS aims to showcase startups doing cool front end work, but also to sharpen our skills. We will split up into small teams, pick a topic of interest (e.g. library, framework, tool) and collaborate on it for an hour or so. Then present our findings for the common good, and the most interesting team wins a fabulous prize! Schedule: Every third Monday of the month. Different venue each time. 7:00pm — Arrival, registration, seating 7:10pm — Intro talk 7:30pm — Teams work on mini challenges 8:30pm — Presentations, awards 9:00pm — The end. More info: http://feds.strikingly.com/ PS: Bring a laptop and show up a bit earlier to get set up on the wifi.
events.location: Migme Hq

events.name: Transport, Travel & Places API Night - Smart Nation API coLAB
events.description:
Padang & Co, together with DEXTRA, is bringing you a whole week of APIs at the Smart Nation API coLAB!   
Putting together partners in the "API Economy" and lots of public and private sector API owners, we'll be exploring how APIs can help unlock business value and play a key role in spurring new innovation. This is the perfect opportunity for you to absorb all things 'API'.   
The coLAB kicks off on Sunday, 15 March with the API LAB, followed by four API Nights during the week spanning themes such as Smart Living, Media & Entertainment, Transport, Travel & Places, Fintech & Commerce . The whole week culminates in a spectacular Hack Day where you can experiment with over 100 APIs and wow us with their hacks during the show-and-tell.    
Transport, Travel & Places API Night - Wednesday, 18 March 
In the third instalment of the themed API Nights, you can dive deep into industries like real estate, travel, and transportation and learn from API owners about how their APIs are making a difference. You will also get to network with partners and fellow like-minded participants to start thinking about what you want to work on at the Hack Day.    
Programme  
7.00pm - Welcome from Lead Partners 
7.20pm - Partners speak about their APIs, followed by Q&A 
9.00pm - Networking    
More Information 
To find out more about the coLAB visit: http://www.upsingapore.com/smart-nation-api-colab. Got any questions? Want to know how you can share your API at the coLAB? Drop us an email.

events.name: WWF Presents - Climate Change And You - Get The Facts talk
events.description:
People in Southeast Asia will be among the worst affected by climate change. Have all your climate change questions answered by as WWF climate change expert and global policy advisor, Mr Sandeep Chamling Rai. Find out how climate change will affect you and how it will affect your food security and water supply. Most importantly, find out what you can do to protect yourself and prevent climate change. 
  
About Mr Sandeep Chamling Rai 
  
With more than 12 years of experience working on climate change issues, Sandeep has been a participant in various United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change negotiation since 2003. 
  
He was also the expert reviewer of Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change’s Fifth Assessment Report (AR5), Working Group II (Impacts, Adaptation, and Vulnerability) report in 2014. 
  
Sandeep holds Master of Science Degree in Environmental Management from Pokhara University, Nepal and National University of Singapore (NUS), Singapore. 
  
  
Please kindly let us know if you are unable to attend the event so that we can better plan our capacity for the event. 
Frequently Asked Questions Is there an age limit to participate in the talk? This talk is recommended for adults and children (Age 6 and above).  
 Will there be food and drinks during the event? Yes. Light snacks and refreshments will be served after the talk. 
 What are my transport/parking options getting to the event? As parking space is limited in the vicinity, we strongly encourage you to come via public transport. The nearest MRT station is Botanic Gardens. And instructions on how to get there can be found here. 
  
I can't make it for the event, how do I go about cancelling my tickets? Please kindly drop us a line via our "Contact the organiser" button or simply email us at member@wwf.sg. 
  
Where can I contact the organiser with any questions? To contact us, please drop us a line via our "Contact The Organiser" button found at the bottom right side of this page. Alternatively, you can email us at member@wwf.sg 
  
Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event? To minimise our impact on the environment, please refrain from printing your tickets but instead flash them on your mobile devices during registration. 
  
Is my ticket transferrable? Yes. Tickets are transferrable. However, to avoid any miscommunication, please email us at member@wwf.sg with the updated contact details of the new attendee as soon as possible. 
 The name on the registration/ticket doesn't match the attendee. Is that okay? Yes. However, to avoid any miscommunication, please email us at member@wwf.sg with the updated contact details of the new attendee as soon as possible.   Can I update my registration information? Yes. Please drop us a line via our "Contact the Organiser" button on this page or email us at member@wwf.sg.
events.location: Singapore Botanic Gardens, , 1 Cluny Road, Botany Centre, Tanglin Gate, Singapore 259569
events.group_name: World Wide Fund For Nature - Singapore (WWF SG)

events.name: Hack Night - The Code Editors Edition
events.description:
Its time to level up on your Editor-Fu, people! 
Choose an editor... any editor, and do something insanely great on it. Practice that nasty (but oh so useful) keyboard combo you've been dying to learn. Share your tooling setup and workflow... and learn some new tricks from your peers. Pick up some ideas on how to improve your productivity and have fun doing it. Make it a date to get some code done quickly (and well)! 
What is your weapon of choice? 
The editors we hope to cover are both terminal-based and GUI-based text editors and IDEs. Vim, emacs, Sublime Text, Atom, Brackets, Light Table, IntelliJ, RubyMine, PyCharm, etc. Most contemporary editors are infinitely extensible and powerful. 
Are you a guru on Sublime Text? Show us why it rivals what people can do on vim and emacs... =] Let us know what makes your shortcuts superior to others. 
Why master your editor? 
Mastery of the shortcuts keys and productivity features in your editor can help you get from idea to code in the shortest possible time. The text editor is the one vital tool of our craft. Its the direct expression of our thoughts into functioning code. 
Come share with us on this journey to enlightenment - in the way of the code!
events.location: Neo Innovation (Singapore), , 53A Craig Road, Singapore null

events.name: March Meetup
events.description: And it's March already ~ About 2 months-ish to RedDotRubyConf ! Have you bought your tickets yet? Anyway, our March meetup is on March 24th, 7pm at PayPal's office. Venue: Millenia Tower, 1 Temasek Avenue, Level 14, Singapore 039192 We are still looking for folks to do 10-15min talk and 5 Random Ruby Tips. Ping us (Anna or Winston)! * Note: Please bring an ID to register yourself at the reception. See you there! -------------- 1. 2. 3. 5 Random Ruby Tips * Hot Picks - This is a 5-10 minute session during which anyone can stand up and say something interesting! -------------- Would you like to speak at our future meetups? You could share about your startup technology stack, your new RubyGem, or your opinions on best practices, so that people can get to know how awesome you are! We also have a 5min section on "5 Random Ruby Tips" that you can volunteer for - I am sure you must have came across some interesting Ruby nuggets in the last month right? So don't be shy! Step forward and share your knowledge! Ping Winston @winstonyw or winstonyw@gmail.com, or Anna @anna_fil or annafil@gmail.com. See you all soon! -------------- Job Postings -------------- Are you looking for Rubyists? Do you have a job posting? Email us a blurb (< 50 words) + link and we'll put it here. 1. Zumata Zumata is a B2B travel startup based at Block 71. We’re a 10-person Ruby/Go team now recruiting 3 devs. Looking for rubyists who love best practices. Our stack is mainly Ruby/Angular across front-end client sites and Go for API / data processing. For more info: jonathan.gomez@zumata.com -------------- Thank You, Sponsors! Food, Venue and Drinks: PayPal
events.location: PayPal Singapore, Millenia Tower, 1 Temasek Avenue, Level 14, Singapore 039192

events.name: TP InfoTechDay 2015: Free Workshops on IT Security Essentials & Forensics & Primer for Social Media Analytics
events.description:
The details of the workshops are as below: 
Track 1 Workshop: IT Security Essentials & Forensics (Starts 3.30pm, 2 hrs) 
This workshop consist of 2 use cases that enhance the network capability within data center from security and data analytics perspective.  1) MapReduce Tracer: EOS MapReduce Tracer tracks and interacts with Hadoop workloads directly connected to Arista switches in a cluster ensuring faster rebalancing and recovery in case of a node failure or congested link. 2) Splunk monitoring: Arista Telemetry application indexes switch inventory, topology, interface counters and statistics, syslog and LANZ data. This data is then exported to the Splunk server via the Universal Forwarder. 
  
Trainer Profile: 
Mr Mark Lee Currently Mark is working as the Senior Systems Engineer at Arista Networks. Mark is very experience in the network field with many years of working experience to back him up.  He is very knowledgeable in the network technology especially in routing, switching, MPLS etc. Mark is also specialized in Brocade and Juniper Network. 
  
Track 2 Workshop: Primer for Social Media Analytics (Starts 12.30pm, 1 hr) 
Data visualization can reveal insights that aren’t always obvious from looking at the raw data, no matter how well organized it may be. For social network, data visualization takes the form of a “social graph,” and it can be a powerful tool to discover deeper meanings and applications behind the relationships and communities within a network. Participants in this workshop will have a hands-on experience in building a social graph of their facebook friends through an interactive visualization and exploration platform. Come and find out more about your very own social network to gain personal insights! 
  
Trainer Profile: 
Goh Kai Song is a lecturer at the School of Informatics & IT in Temasek Polytechnic.  Kai Song is a double Master’s degree holder, having graduated from the National University of Singapore with a Master’s Degree in Computing, as well as a Master’s Degree in Education from the University of Sheffield (UK). He had conducted workshops and seminars on business intelligence & analytics. Kai Song’s research interest is in the application of analytics in the area of education.   
  
Samantha Sow is a lecturer at the School of Informatics & IT in Temasek Polytechnic. Samantha graduated from the National University of Singapore with First Class Honours Degree in Engineering. Her specialisation is in Mathematics & Statistics, and she believes in sharing her knowledge and skills to nurture the future generation and work force.
events.location: Temasek Polytechnic Auditorium 2 & Foyer, , 21 Tampines Avenue 1, Singapore 529757
events.group_name: Temasek Polytechnic School of Informatics & IT

events.name: TP InfoTechDay 2015: All About Big Data & Smart Solutions (IoT) Seminar
events.description:
TP InfoTechDay 2015 is an annual event since 1998 to showcase innovative projects by our senior students from the School of Informatics & IT to industry partners. The showcase includes projects developed in collaboration with industry partners and various agencies and provides an opportunity for both students and industry guests to discuss employment opportunities.  This year, as part of our 25th anniversary celebration, we have also invited speakers from SCS, CISCO, Singtel and NCS to share on the latest trends for Big Data & Smart Solutions. SCS Data Analytics Chapter will be our official event partner. 




Topic 
  


Analytics in the Cognitive Era 




First Speaker Profile 
 
  
  


James Kocis is the Analytics Leader for IBM’s Globally Integrated Capability.  James leads Business Analytics & Strategy delivery resources that are based in eight centres globally: India, China, Philippines, Romania, Egypt, Brazil, Mexico, and Argentina.  James also is responsible for an Analytics Solutioning team that architects innovative solutions for clients globally. These solutions leverage Cloud, Analytics, Mobile, Social, and Security capabilities based on assets from IBM Research, Software, Hardware, and Services divisions.  
James has over 20 years of industry and consulting experience. Prior to his current role, James was the worldwide Strategy and Operations leader for IBM’ Business Analytics team, the large deal leader for IBM Japan’s Analytics team, and held a variety of sales, project management, and delivery roles.   
James is currently on the executive steering committee for the Centre for Business Analytics at the National University of Singapore (NUS). James is from New York City but he and his family have lived in Singapore for two years. 
 



Synopsis 
  


We are entering a new era of computing. From tabulating systems to programmable computers, now cognitive computing represents a huge leap forward. This new era brings with it fundamental differences in how systems are built and interact with humans.  We have recently seen Analytics move to the forefront of the CxO agenda.  With the advent of Cognitive Computing, we now have the opportunity to take Analytics to the next level and achieve outcomes previously unimaginable. 
  




  




Topic 


Handling Big Data with Google Cloud Platform 
  




Second Speaker Profile 
 


Krishnan is a Google Developer Expert (GDE) in Google Cloud Platform (GCP). He is the first GDE in GCP from SEA and currently the only one in GCP as well. Krishnan is also a co-founder of Google Developer Group, Singapore and founded the same in 2009. He has helped to organise a total of 50 developer-focused events as part of this community activity as of Dec 2014. 
Krishnan is currently with Institute for Infocomm Research, Singapore. He has 16+ years of industry experience in Cloud Computing, High Performance Computing, Computer Security, Data Analytics, and Embedded Systems. Earlier, Krishnan graduated with PhD in Computer Engineering (High Performance Computing) from National University of Singapore, Singapore and before that with MS by Research in Computer Science (Systems security) from NUS as well. 
 



Synopsis 


In this talk, the speaker will present the technical aspects of big data technologies and products that are part of the Google Cloud Platform. In addition, the talk will focus on few other technologies from Google Cloud Platform that are required for pre- and post-processing of big data. 
  




  




Topic 


Defining the Internet of Everything 
  




Third Speaker Profile 
 


Rajiv Niles, Director, IOE Innovation Platforms, Cisco Systems 
 As the Director of IOE Innovation Platforms at Cisco Systems, Rajiv oversees the strategy, the development and the go-to-market of IOE soluations. As an 18-year veteran in the IT space, he has played a pivotal role in developing centers of innovation and developing new paradigms for innovating at the edge. In his current role, he has been responsible for overseeing Cisco’s investments in the IOE companies and developing an eco-system of partnerships to drive new solutions in vertical segments including Smart Cities, Manufacturing and Mining. 
Joining Cisco in 1999, he quickly become known as a highly capable technologist with a strong understanding of Cisco’s business to transform the way the company thought about solutions and its foray into vertical industries. 
Originally from Sri-Lanka, Rajiv lives in Singapore. He earned a bachelor’s degree in electronic engineering from the University of Western Australia. He is a Cisco Certified Internetworking Expert (CCIE) and Certified Enterprise Architect. He is married and has two children. 
 



Synopsis 


The Internet of Everything is here. More people, processes, data and things are connecting. It's creating more compelling experiences, new markets and greater efficiency than ever before. IT leaders around the world must now embrace this new model, making themselves more strategic and more nimble, and a source of innovation and transformation across their organization. In this session we’ll take a look at an industry view of the Internet of Everything and the opportunity that it presents all of us. 
  




  



Topic
Smart Policing: Developing "Information for Action" Through Big Data Analytics



Fourth Speaker Profile 
 


Dr Clifton Phua,Associate Director, Analytics | Smart and Safe City Centre of Excellence. Clifton is at NCS Group, working on Big Data analytics for customers. In his free time, he volunteers professional services to events, conferences, and journals (related to data mining/analytics, security and health informatics). Was also part of teams which won some analytics competitions. 
His specialization was Big Data analytics in public security (attack and disaster preparation/recovery/response; cyber security; internal security; and predictive policing) and fraud (government, banking, and insurance). 
He is an associate editor for the IEEE Transactions on Big Data (IEEE TBD) and Big Data Journal, and editorial board member of International Journal of Cyber Warfare and Terrorism. In addition, he is a program committee member of IEEE International Conference on Big Data, Joint Intelligence and Security Informatics Conference, and International Symposium on Foundations of Open Source Intelligence and Security Informatics. 
His teams have won challenges such as GE Flight Quest Phase 1 Competition 2013 and Fraud Detection in Mobile Advertising Competition 2012. He has published more than 30 technical papers on various industry applications of data analytics, such as fraud detection and activity recognition. 
Clifton’s PhD (on identity crime detection) and bachelor's (first class honors) degrees are from Clayton School of Information Technology, Monash University, Australia. 
  



Synopsis
Smart policing is the use of analytical techniques in law enforcement to address crime and policing problems more effectively. The consistent strategic problem faced by law enforcement agencies globally is how to achieve the best results with limited resources.  This includes maintaining public order, reducing crime, or maintaining the current status quo with reduced resources. In order to solve these issues, we must discover the actionable predictors (such as time and weather) of different types of crime, specific to each location or place type (such as a neighborhood or nightclub), in order that resources are used to best effect. This talk examines preliminary results using the UK Police Crimes and Outcomes dataset from December 2010 to June 2014, which has a relatively large volume: more than 19 million crime and anti-social behavior incidents from 43 police forces ( please see http://data.police.uk/ ).



  
 FAQs 
Where can I contact the organiser with any questions? 
Please feel free to email ryanlbk@tp.edu.sg if you have any questions.
events.location: Temasek Polytechnic Auditorium 2 & Foyer, , 21 Tampines Avenue 1, Singapore 529757

events.name: Silicon chips with quantum inside?
events.description:
Silicon Chips with Quantum Insides? 
For over half a century, silicon has been the material platform for the information processing revolution that has transformed our society. From Silicon Valley to Silicon Straits, this humble material has become synonymous with high-tech enterprise driven by the ever increasing computation power and shrinking size of CMOS processors. However, transistors cannot simply keep getting smaller (the characteristic size of CMOS transistors is now only 60 atoms wide). At these scales, the bizarre laws of quantum mechanics come into play: electrons can be in two places at once (called ‘superposition), and can ‘tunnel’ through barriers. Controlling electrons at these scales becomes a bit like herding (Schrödinger) cats, making it impossible to build basic computing components. Chip designers today have been using all their ingenuity to fend off this ‘quantum limit’ for a few more years with novel designs, but reaching the limit is inevitable. Instead of trying to work around these troublesome quantum effects, it is possible to build an entirely new type of computer whose operation fundamentally relies on quantum features such as superposition. There are a wide range of different technologies being explored to build such a ‘quantum computer’, including arrays of trapped ions addressed by lasers, and circuits of superconducting aluminium kept a few thousands of a degree above absolute zero. Recent results from laboratories around the world suggest that silicon could in fact provide a platform for such quantum processors - this include superposition states that last for 3 hours, or being able to measure individual dopant atoms in silicon nano-devices. We still have a little way to go before silicon can be considered to be on an equal footing with other quantum computing designs, but this isn’t the first time silicon has played catch-up. After all, lead sulfide and germanium were used to make transistors before high-purity silicon and CMOS technology came along. So far, we have every reason to think that silicon will survive the next big computational leap, from the classical to the quantum age. 
  
John Morton studies the coherent control of electron and nuclear spins in solid state materials and devices, with a focus on quantum technologies. Quantum technologies are ones which exploit quantum superposition and entanglement to achieve major advances over current technologies in areas including communication, sensing and information processing. 
  
  
  
  
  
  
This event is organised by the Centre for Quantum Technologies, National University of Singapore in partnership with the Science Centre Singapore.
events.location: Science Centre Singapore, , 15 Science Centre Rd, Singapore 609081
events.group_name: Centre for Quantum Technologies, National University of Singapore

events.name: ISS Seminar: Digital Analytics – The Game Changer for the Hospitality Industry
events.description:
Hospitality managers need to enhance the way they make decisions by using actionable insights through the use of digital analytics.  
Online reservations, reviews and ratings in the hospitality industry, have led to the managers owning numerous data. 
But what does the manager do with this data? In order to manage the business well, the manager needs to use the data to answer the many questions that management is interested in. And also to help them make better decisions to increase productivity and sales, and to improve their customers' experience. 
For example, management may be interested in, “Who is likely to be a guest at the hotel and why?”, or “What is the average daily rate per room?”, or “What is the vacancy rate of the hotel?” 
There are many analytical techniques that can answer these business questions. Techniques in “Predictive Analytics”, “Channel Distribution Optimisation”, “Customer Analytics”, “Recommendation Systems”, and others. 
We have invited hospitality experts to tell us how digital analytics can help managers: 

Determine who are their guests and profile them
Understand why guests choose their hotel/airline/restaurant/services
Determine guest satisfaction with their services
Which guests rate their services highly and how to improve guest satisfaction
To design  more effective digital strategy campaigns
Perform comparative analysis among hotels 
Better understand the competitive landscape.

 The hospitality industry is extremely competitive. Managers need to be more proactive in their decision making or their competitors will soon beat them at their own game and become the new leaders in the industry. 
The use of digital analytics is growing in the hospitality industry. Come and learn from hospitality experts, how to make good use of your data when making decisions.  
 Who should attend 
Professionals in the hospitality industry who are interested to find out how their organisations can gain competitive advantage over their competitors by making data-driven decisions.   
 For more information, visit https://www.iss.nus.edu.sg/Events/ISSSeminars/DigitalAnalyticsTheGameChangerfortheHospi.aspx
events.location: Institute of Systems Science, NUS, , 25 Heng Mui Keng Terrace, Singapore 119615

events.name: Join Us for Mobile UEM – Gaining insight of mobile users’ behavior
events.description: Whether you are well established e-Commerce brand such as Zalora, Agoda or a small business with a web shop, it’s never too late to gain more insights into your customers’ end user experience to make better decisions on where next to spend engineering and marketing money. With the establishment of mobile web and native mobile apps, your website isn't the only customer touch point anymore and it is critical to deliver the same user experience across all the channels (Mobile App/Mobile Web/Web). In order to do that you need to find a way to monitor and measure user experience across your delivery channels to allow both business and engineers to make the right decisions on where to invest time and money to improve user experience. Join us, as Andreas Grabner, Technology Strategist at Dynatrace, shares best practices from different global companies and learn: - which metrics you really need to monitor across your channels -how to make data-driven decisions based on these metrics -changing your deployment model of applications and new features to become metric driven and not just demand driven
events.location: Molly Roffey's Irish Pub (Bras Basah) , #01-02A Manulife Centre, 51 Bras Basah Rd.,, Singapore

events.name: Front End TL;DR April 2015
events.description: We are being hosted by Smartkarma, a young startup disrupting the financial industry. They are located in Changi Business Park (Expo MRT) because that's where most financial institutions have their IT operations. FEDS is about hands-on, collaborative learning. Join the session if you'd like to learn new front end technology. Schedule: Every third Monday of the month. Different venue each time. 7:00pm — Arrival, registration, seating 7:10pm — Intro talk 7:30pm — Teams work on mini challenges 8:30pm — Presentations, awards 9:00pm — The end. More info: http://feds.strikingly.com/ PS: Bring a laptop and show up a bit earlier to get set up on the wifi.
events.location: Smartkarma

events.name: Maker Faire Singapore
events.description: Maker Faire Singapore is back for the 4th year! And this time we are featured, thanks to the enthusiastic support from the Maker Community in Singapore
events.location: 15, Tampines street 11

events.name: Hebocon Singapore (Robotics competition for the technically ungifted)
events.description: The search for Singapore's worst robot will take place some time this year (most likely in July 2015). Known as Japan’s "worst robot competition”, the purpose of the HEBOCON event is to find out which crappy robot is the ultimate failure of them all through a sumo-styled wrestling battle. Preparations are being made to bring this quirky robotic competition to Singapore. We are looking for venue hosts, sponsors, contributors and supporters for this inaugural event. More details about guidelines and rules of competition will be announced in March 2015. Meanwhile stay cute and unskillful! If you're interested to participate, please indicate your attendance here. Thank you. *the date indicated below is a tentative one. the confirmed schedule will be release in Mar 2015 For more information about HEBOCON, check out the official page at https://www.facebook.com/Hebocon.Official
events.location: TBD
